structure.unit: ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES -- PROHIBITIONS, RESTRICTIONS, AND REGULATIONS

law.catch_line: Brewer or distributor prohibited from offering certain inducements to retailers -- Brewer or distributor may furnish advertising matter or cleaning service to retailer.

text.section:
Notwithstanding any provisions in KRS Chapter 244 and this section, a brewer or distributor may:
Give, rent, loan, or sell to any retailer selling malt beverages by the package or drink signs, posters, placards, designs, devices, decorations, or graphic displays bearing advertising matter and for use in windows or elsewhere in the interior of a retail malt beverage establishment; and
Provide or furnish draught-line cleaning or coil-cleaning service to a nonquota retail malt beverage package licensee either directly or indirectly with the consent of the distributor.

law.history: Amended 2013 Ky. Acts ch. 121, sec. 97, effective June 25, 2013. -- Amended 2004 Ky. Acts ch. 120, sec. 4, effective July 13, 2004. -- Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. sec. 2554b-213.
